'Methyl cyanoacrylate' ('MCA') is an organic compound that contains several
functional groups, a methyl ester, a nitrile, and an alkene. It is a colorless
liquid with low viscosity. Its chief use is as the main component of
cyanoacrylate glues. [http://www.inchem.org/documents/icsc/icsc/eics1272.htm
Methyl 2-cyanoacrylate] at Inchem.org It can be encountered under many
trade names. Methyl cyanoacrylate is less commonly encountered than ethyl
cyanoacrylate.

It is soluble in acetone, methyl ethyl ketone, nitromethane, and
dichloromethane. [http://www.palmlabsadhesives.com/technical_data.htm Palm
Labs Adhesives] MCA polymerizes rapidly in presence of moisture.
